title: Quadrapassel: un-clickable menus make the game unplayable

sentences.text: When I open quadrapassel, none of the menus (game, settings, help) can be clicked.
Launching the game from gnome-terminal gives no output errors nor warnings.
Versions of packages quadrapassel depends on:
Le dimanche 23 octobre 2011  17:55 +0200, Camalen a crit :
> When I open quadrapassel, none of the menus (game, settings, help) can be
What are your graphics hardware and driver?
El 2011-10-24 a las 10:12 +0200, Josselin Mouette escribi:
> Le dimanche 23 octobre 2011  17:55 +0200, Camalen a crit :
> > When I open quadrapassel, none of the menus (game, settings, help) can be
> What are your graphics hardware and driver?
It's an Intel N10 Family Integrated Video Controller using i915 driver.
I filled a profile for this netbook into Debian's HCL:
Same problem here on a netbook Asus eeepc 901 with Intel graphics, but I'm not sure that that's related with the graphics: menus are simply unresponsive, the same as shortcut commands like ctlr+n.
Versions of packages quadrapassel depends on:
That's present also on different graphics: I can confirm it on an Asus with AMD64 and Nvidia geforce go 7300 with proprietary drivers.
Versions of packages quadrapassel depends on:
I can report the same problem on Debian Wheezy amd64.
Graphics card is a Sapphire Radeon HD 5770 Vapor-X, using the r600g driver from git (not Debian's).
Behavior has been observed in the Xfce DE;
Menus do not display when clicked, and there are no responses from the user interface.
It seems to be running -- the UI redraws properly when the window is resized -- but is otherwise useless.
One series of errors is printed to the terminal:
(quadrapassel:14218): Clutter-WARNING **: The required ID of 1523831 does not refer to an existing actor;
this usually implies that the pick() of an actor is not correctly implemented or that there is an error in the glReadPixels() implementation of the GL driver.
The number of the required ID is not consistent.
These messages seem to appear inconsistently several seconds after attempted interaction with the user interface.
Versions of packages quadrapassel depends on:
I see the bug also with Intel 945GM graphics.
Menus are non clickable, it is impossible to start any game.
All other gnome games work normally.
Versions of packages quadrapassel depends on:
Quadrapassel is now working for me.
If other users who were experincing the  problem can check and confirm it works also for them, I will close the bug.
> Quadrapassel is now working for me.
If other users who were experincing the  > problem can check and confirm it works also for them, I will close the bug.
Works for me too now in testing.

It printed no information or errors.
